kcwUTphssVCTnSPi3j-zxA.text: I like to visit coffee@bermondsey in the morning for a quick coffee and delicious yogurt/granola breakfast creation they stock - it's not made in-house but everything in it is fresh and organic, produced by Laura's Idea. I can highly recommend it - it comes in a vegan version too for those of you out there who are into that. I have eaten lunch here a number of times, not because the food is great, but because it is directly across the road from where I work and I often don't have long for a lunch break. Their lunch-time food consists of pre-packaged sandwiches which they'll toast for you. They're okay, but I find a number of their sandwiches are a bit samey. They also sell soups and salads (I don't think either are made in house) and these are also okay, but everything is just a tad too expensive. Having said that, their custard tarts are worth every penny! As Rob has said in a previous review, they are trying a bit too hard to be quirky (the lampshades are made out of cardboard coffee tops) and lately I've been taking my lunch back to the office because it gets really crowded and they often play the music too loud.

hRNZZ5gFM6aL1AFDOBRVLQ.text: This may not be the most amazing coffee house in all of London, but it is definitely the best in the London Bridge area. Yes the decor is 'different', with paper-cup lampshades and breezeblock walls, but it's still a great place to chill out, especially for those who work in the area and want a break from the office. There is a good selection of organic salads and sandwiches on offer, albeit pre-packed, and the coffees and teas are the real thing. The idea of this place is to not take things too seriously, it's just a fun cafe where you can grab a cup of coffee or a quick lunch. An added touch is the jar of doggie biscuits at the back for whoever happens to have brought their canine friend along.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

4ybeRvUgbNqFdQXirI5Jvg.text: It's been awhile since I've been here, and it doesn't stand out too vividly in my mind. I remember being pleased with what I got (which was probably a latte.) What I do remember is some nice, laid back house music playing in the cafe, which I like. Being from America, where electronic music is considered a novelty, I was pleased with its ubiquitous presence.

pzZl4VtfeNoqwipSSYbQKA.text: I used to live on Bermondsey street and this was one of my favourite places to hang out. Yes it's not dirt cheap and the food options are a little eclectic, but it's a great chilled out, arty atmosphere and even on a busy weekday lunch it's not overly crowded (just more difficult to find a place to sit). With free wifi, magazines, papers and funky music playing (but not too loudly) it's a great place for a quick lunch or a long, lingering coffee afternoon. The hot sandwiches come presented in a little cardboard lunchbox with a handful of crisps  brilliant concept. They also sell a range of fruit and healthy snack bars at the counter. Ohand the counter always has the day's horoscopes cut out and on display. A brilliant way to while away a few seconds whilst waiting for your order. Ohand I'm not sure if they do this any more, but as recently as a year ago, they gave out glittery headbands with springy ear-things as your 'number' when waiting for an order. So weird..but in a good way.

H-oBjnKHw50rwOCHgzFSWw.text: The coffee here is very good for the local area, although that might not be saying too much as coffee in SE1 seems to be pretty poor. There is free wifi and very handily it is open fairly late.

ZzbQ7C6oadhDCql8ssBofw.text: Ive been here a few times. Often when waiting for my girlfriend to finish work.Its not a place i would go to in order to chill out. I use this place mearly as a place to get out of the rain. The coffee is not that great. I would stick to the bottle drinks and packet cakes and cookies. the instore made food is not that great. Not my favourite coffeehouse in the world.

JAqrzo3Imtp0O4cIJCkD1A.text: I always go at the weekend as Bermondsay is so quiet and the coffee shop is no different. Everytime I've gone, I've got a seat and its quiet enough to get on with reading. Really cool setting and comfortable seats. Free wifi aswell.

pmOWpmXdLpZozRFRtxfTSQ.text: Great coffee; a neighbourhood favourite both for working and chilling on their comfy sofas. I haven't tried the food but the lunch menu does look really good.

pbhG9ZpSq9kot0W0CXPhOw.text: My new local coffee shop. I'm here on the daily. It's pretty fucking hipster, I admit. But I'm okay with that.Get the banana mocha frapp - so good.

XgJnqK6ncH8xfJ_rduiI_A.text: Lovely coffee shop with a great atmosphere. The back is full of squishy sofas and they play chilled disco/house type music. The staff are friendly and the coffee is good. The cakes are delicious and the local noticeboard adds a homely feel. You can easily spend a Saturday afternoon here chatting with friends. Well worth a visit if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

CFdzmLe-Q8fYZzTDahKZKA.text: I'm sorry.The coffee here is consistently a bit shit.

NMDDj66S2gUvez0CFZkm8g.text: I always try to get a space here as it's close to uni and a great place to work. The coffee is really tasty if you're a beginner to the whole coffee thing (like me) but it is a little expensive and the place is mostly packed. However, on the plus side, I love the music they play there and the staff are very friendly and accomodating. Definitely my go to place for a lounge about in some comfy chairs. Oh and the multitudes of dogs are just adorable!

eK9YLLILqH8gSCT5uo_x2A.text: I like the feel of the place. It's got that quirky hipster try-hard thing going on a little, but if you're ok with that then you won't mind. What you might mind are the staff acting like it's their very own social club and perhaps thinking that them having fun with their mates is more important than getting you your lunch or potentially very average coffee. The soup I had was excellent though, as was the muffin, so I'm a bit torn. I'll probably go back if I have the chance, but won't be making the trip especially.It'll always be a slightly busy in there as it's right amongst it on the happening Bermondsey Street.

4Bbqmsku-u0D7qmjaN3JxQ.text: I tend to think of coffee shops as having two important elements: 1) the coffee, preferably in espresso form, and 2) the lounging factor (ie comfort & availability of couches, type of atmosphere, quality of WiFi). This is one of five Coffee@ cafes around town and is usually quite busy, especially on weekends.First, the joe. Bermondsey Street Coffee (BSC) produces a decent espresso (I reckon they probably use Union beans as opposed to my preferred Monmouth) which I'm happy to sit casually sipping although the chai tea latte was a bit bland. In all fairness, I do like strong flavours that pack a punch whereas the chai tea was more like my little cousin's attempts to try to tickle me - you know what it's trying to do but it's just not working.Lounging-wise, this place is pretty comfortable with a ton of couches and easy chairs that are deeply padded and mostly clean. It invites you to sink in and fall into a semi-comatose daze which is perfect after wandering through Borough Market for a couple of hours and then trying to make it home. There are also more study tables and chairs for those who want to get some work done as well as a whole row of power sockets in the front half so you can plug in your computer and not worry about battery life. Music is quite chilled house-type and varies depending on which barista plugged in their iPod I think. Overall, fits well with the general atmosphere. I've got to give props for the creative use of legos and only wish they laid some out alongside the board games for me to entertain my inner child.There is free wifi (well for an hour at least) and you can get the password from the baristas which essentially means you either need to be shameless or order something. Prices aren't too bad so don't worry about it, beats the hell out of Starbucks for sure. Unfortunately, the wifi is pretty slow and not good for more than basic emails with facebook and even some google searches taking a bit of time to load. Don't bother trying to stream music or video, it's hopeless. For reference, when I was trying to connect it was about 11am and there were maybe a handful of people in the shop. I can't imagine what it's like when the place is rammed.BSC also has a selection of sandwiches and I think even hot paninis (all organic and healthyish of course) plus the usual array of muffins, cookies, and pastries. I haven't yet sampled the food so no comments there.Overall, a good place to grab a coffee or sit and relax for a while. It's on the way to work for me so that helps too and given the rarity of places to relax away from tourists in London Bridge it's a winner for that alone.

MeYUkr8HmcL8xXyHXXTKlg.text: Whenever I enter a coffee@ location (or the coffee shops formerly known as...) I instantly feel as if I've slipped and fallen back into my teenage years growing up in Seattle. Before I have time to stop myself, it's 1990-something, I'm wearing flannel, rocking braces, VHS taping every episode of My So Called Life, listening to grunge music on my walkman and debating whether I should buy some JNCOs, or if they look 'way too skater' on me.   The funky mismatched atmosphere and the trendily uncouth vibe as well as the above average coffee perpetuate this Seattle upbringing flashback, and for the record, there is nothing wrong with this. In fact, I oft enjoy a trip back in time - especially when it involves said above average coffee, some organic juices and softs and some locally made munchies. The present day BSC experience also involves a connection to the world wide web that doesn't make robot sex sounds, although I would trade that futuristic perk for Jordan Catalano any day.

nuMd9UJUHEi9MdXknnEsOA.text: Love the vibe of this hip cafe filled with awesome music, couches, and people on their macs and ipads.  Prewrapped sandwiches can be toasted although didn't try them (nor did I try the coffee).  Opted for a smoothie which was standard fare.I just really enjoyed the atmosphere--I could sink in here for a good long time.  One thing that does bother me though is that everything is served in paper and plastic, even if you are consuming in.  That sucks.

s3CFa-27joizyW4Ot9f1WA.text: Dope ass coffee shop! Its got the hipster ass couches and wall decor and everything! Good coffee too and relatively cheap if your from the UK. The vibe of this place is amazing. Friendly staff, good coffee (i got the americano) and plenty of room and space to chill. Its close by to a place I intern so i expect to be here often.

I-t_UTLqaK9VaWNANQ2eaQ.text: It isn't exactly accessible by public transit, but if you find yourself in the neighborhood do drop in for a quick cup.  This kitschy little joint has a NYC Soho feel and is popular with the yuppie locals.  Can't speak for the other brews but my mochas have been quite consistent, though service is a tad on the slow side.  But that isn't what Bermondsey Street is about, is it?

8rDDaGQ3qrpOHslJT5VZTw.text: I'm rather fond of the Coffee@ shops. They don't do fantastic coffee, nor are they incredibly cheap, and the tables seem to be perpetually dirty. So why do I like this place? Well, they have a whole bunch of magazines and newspapers for those who need something to ride. The walls are nicely decorated with neon signs, while the lampshades are made up of paper espresso cups. They have free wi-fi. Music's fairly decent (today, they seemed to be playing loads of songs from The Cure). They've got sofas and cushions. All in all, it's a great place to catch up with friends for a long period of time. In fact, I think it'll be a great place to continue a date after lunch nearby. It's just got that kind of incredibly comfortable vibe without being too crowded (at least not in all the weekends I've been there).

2HbKOT2dVJ78wAcsEjmibg.text: Certainly not the best anything that anyone has ever seen, but I really like this place, all the same. They have nice teas and good fresh juices. The pastries are lovely, and I like the kicky decor, the awesome artwork on the walls, the staff, the storefront, the people watching. It's particularly pleasant on a sunny summer day... it's nice and airy inside, but not too bright. I also appreciate the vegetarian offerings. The place is just funky and refreshing, with nothing else like it in the area. To be honest, that's why I ended up here in the first place. It's near my friend's flat, so stopping in began as a convenience. But I came back because it's just awesome.

baOJpib_eo2MbWyGl4u2SQ.text: This funky little cafe serves us well where I work. Just around the corner from the office, it's the perfect place to grab a hot mug of something and a healthy bite to eat and relax during our lunch break. Comfy couches, bizarre modern art, free wifi, hip magazines... I could go on.As Hannah R. mentioned previously, I was drawn to it originally because of the chalkboard outside, which read "Americans now welcome" after Obama was elected. It's that type of place.When you order food (a sandwich, a cup of soup), instead of receiving a number or a token, you get a nice sparkling headband with glittery gold springs. Of course, you don't HAVE to wear them, but what's the fun in holding something like that in your hand?Mostly vegan/vegetarian food is served here, but I can vouch for it's tastiness (and this is coming from an avid meat eater).Also, during the holiday season, they hung their christmas tree upside down from the ceiling, with a Buzz Lightyear doll grabbing onto the top (bottom).

lqmj6l_KrX4exB637CNcPw.text: Well this is one of an endangered species now.  The mother of all the coffee@place on Brick Lane has gone bankrupt and now just the odds and sods remain scattered over the London.It is absolutely ok, does better than Starbucks coffee, has better than Starbucks snacks.  Apart from that it doesn't really stand out.  It probably has free wifi... The only unique thing about it is perching in the sun outside and watching people wander up and down Bermondsey Street with their cute dogs.  Now that is fun.

q086n2aWkPKsTqT-nX0t0A.text: My friend Emily and I dragged ourselves groggily over to Coffee@Bermondsey St after a late Saturday night.  She recommended the place, and, if ever her good taste was in question, it is now assured as excellent.I had tea and a sultana croissant and oh how lovely it was like birds chirping on a warm, dewy morning.  The croissant was properly flaky and the nettle tea was interested and fine quality.  We sank into one of the big, comfy, lovingly worn leather couches and noshed.  There are silly decorations (in the best of ways) sitting around the cafe ranging from toy robots to tiny model cars.  The cafe has a nice selection of drinks, hot and cold, and cafe-style food.  They even have a sense of humor: it was the weekend after the US election and written on their board was the statement "Americans now welcome."  They write in chalk in random places on the inside and outside, lending to an artsy, fun feel.Great place for a light bite or cozy coffee.

a6IdNcQSOIm2VcY4BA12eQ.text: Just a note to say:i love this place so much.great coffee and great atmosphere.just to clear things up for those wondering, the coffee@ chain went over the summer but this one, the Brick Lane one and the Goswell Road one have now opened.This one is called Bermondsey Street Coffee and its the same brilliant place it was just with a new name. :)The other two are obviously called 'Brick Lane Coffee' and 'Goswell Road Coffee'.

Xym7yYeP1-5uZbs0bHWk3A.text: I love this place as much for the weird and wonderful decor as the coffee and sandwiches. Think coffee cups made in to lampshades, plastic toys arranged in formation all around the counter, yummy coffee and healthy, organic food plus wifi - that's the dream! The fact that it's located in the southernmost part of Bermondsey Street, one of my favourite London streets for its skinny, cobbled loveliness, quaint little shops, relative quiet (on the weekends at least) and access to the bustle of London Bridge and it's surprising I don't while away more hours at Coffee@.

8ZSk8Aq1DhN0dgKGeIZuQQ.text: I was recommended this place. I like the magazines and friendly informal notice board best. It has rather a lot of peroxide lladies networking people, so it is a bit liike being on the Apprentice, but, if you are lucky, you can get a seat away from them.

u0-MFeLvL9kxlgI7MuWc-g.text: Bermondsey Street is such a boutique alleyway, and there should be strong competition for a fine coffee along here. Sadly there isn't, nevertheless, Coffee@Bermondsey is a shining light - especially for a coffee particular like most of us Kiwis :) Good coffee for starters, free wifi and great couches. This is laptop central in here! Generally great vibe, chalkboards covered in witticisms. Though generally great, the staff are sometimes a bit casual. Would give four and a half stars but not five - as there's always room for improvement.

ngnPk32YiC_x-RuqPxm1yg.text: Came here multiple times while I was in London. Loved their staff and the funky vibe of this coffee shop. Their baked goods are great, too. Highly recommend checking this place out.

eRHtEhi3hVmq9kJ-TYYB9w.text: The best thing about this place was reading the determination of the trademark commission when the owners of this place attempted to register it. To say that it was amusing was an understatement, and they have it on pride of place for everybody to see it if they want a bit of a laugh. Anyway, it seems as if they manage to actually get the name approved since it is the name that I find plastered on most parts of the internet (though some sites seem to want to censor at least a part of the name). Anyway, it seems as if the owners of this place try to go out of their way to cause offense, but honesty I basically came here because of the name, and to also see what their coffee was like. Well, considering the line that eventually went out of the door, it is pretty clear as to how popular this place is (though not as popular as another place I visited on this side of the Thames). In fact the place was almost close to being packed. As for the coffee, well I have to admit that it wasn't bad at all, which suggests that people end up here for reasons other than the name.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

KgIGdLmETJfiPIgnodutDw.text: Nice place with good coffee (finally a place which sells proper american filtered coffee and not only Americano) at very reasonable prices.

S007PTzTtNbjj75tnYZCwg.text: Coffee is great and the WiFi fast and free. Very comfortable seating with some cool folks just hanging around. Will be back.

Rs3wbIji6yoA9HmXOgMDgg.text: It's an independant coffee shop (not the usual Starbucks, Pret, Neros) in London which is a plus.It's got a cool decor. It's loyalty card is unique.  It gets an A-OK 3 stars as there always seems to be a queue outside the door when I go there. I must just go at the wrong times. Not bad but there are better places too

cy86I1mLFlus-QtFFD9BvQ.text: Fuckoffee can't fuck off at all because I need it to satisfy my everyday caffeine and pastry requirements. The coffee here is spot on and you get a loyalty card as extra inspiration. Their almond croissants are worth every last calorie and there are other pastries here too that look pretty good (but I'm boring when it comes to this stuff). For non breakfast needs, they have all sorts of soups, salads and sandwiches and things to keep vegans happy. Highly recommended is the Thai chicken soup. And all of the salads, although they are small. So basically you can get a pastry and a soup and they cancel each other out. Right? All of the items that you get here come in take away form. There is hour long wifi and lots of seats. Be prepared to share your couch/table. If you can, grab a window seat or a spot outside: people watching bonanza.Always good music here.

WDlg7HyCubpku5cIjsZ87w.text: Loads of charachter in this one. Across from the White Cube gallery. Music is awesome. People are friendly and easy going. Couches are slouch inducing. And you can buy bitcoins at the bitcoins ATM lol.

-97ThGbXmelikWBqQoscuw.text: This is one of my favorite coffee shops in London.  I especially love that it's on Bermondsey Street, which is filled with more restaurants than cafes.  I love coming here to work or simply to get a coffee to go.  The coffee is good, the hot chocolate is delectable, the service is friendly and the atmosphere is fun!  Only thing is it can be hard to get a seat, but all in all, a great spot!

1r6uBtO7Cy-PuJC3KR7TQQ.text: Fun place with Lego details! I had a coffee frappe and it was awesome! Much better than Starbucks!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom. Legoooooooo

C4oU-c31QdokB0o9ca16Aw.text: There are good coffee shops in London. Unfortunately, this isn't one of them. The coffee is pretty good, but it's not "£4 for a 'medium' as tall as my pinky finger" good. I also can't quite figure out how it takes such a long time to make the drinks. There are consistently 4+ people behind the counter. One person asks for your order, the next person enters it into the till, then a third person writes it on the cup, and a fourth person grinds the beans, and then....you get the point. The service is shit. Not only is it slow, but it comes with a serious attitude from the individuals making the drinks. They give off the "I can't believe you're bothering me" vibe. Maybe they are trying to be "cool"? I'm not into it. They seem to care very little about the line of customers trying desperately to caffeinate themselves, and very much about carrying on conversations with each other. I once waited 11 minutes for an Americano. Now, let's talk about the atmosphere. While at first glance it looks pretty cozy, I often find it difficult to score a seat. The place is crawling with people who use it as a remote office...all day. Because it's a long and narrow space, you often find yourself in a corner in the rear and it's a pretty dreary place to be 9 months out of the year. Not welcoming, poor service, and the coffee, while several steps up from Starbucks, isn't worth the trouble. Head to Hej Coffee in Bermondsey Square instead. You'll find clever and lovely staff, amazing coffee, and a bright and welcoming interior.

ck3QZtqRuVqxqHxw4MjCCw.text: Nor just a brilliant name :) very good strong coffee too, I use it when in the area, it is tucked between London bridge and tower bridge road.As it was said by others the loyalty cards are quite fun too, worth a stop for your caffeine fix when passing by

3UmOrJ9N4KyYb3Bl8_8QFg.text: Cute spot. Was my neighborhood bar when visiting. They did coffee right. From my vacation I realized that London did espresso right and Paris did tea right. Oh the irony.

voodvPkPxu8c05wlke07uw.text: Vibrant coffee shop with a decent flat white. It can be difficult to get a seat since many people with laptops seem to camp out here for a while. Not my favourite, but not a bad place for a little coffee either.

NP6YlEUUwr4fM5YamZ5OnA.text: My friend told me about the cafe with the audacious name, but I wasn't expecting the coffee to actually be any good. But it IS. They have the best loyalty card as well, so remember to get one from them when you visit. Absolutely love the funky decor and the mood lighting. It's not the best place to do work (lack of table space is one thing) but it's perfect for a meetup and catchup. Go for the funky name, stay for the fabulous coffee.

uymCsowA9M0wSvTbV5J9Rw.text: It can be terrifying to explore big cities alone sometimes. Especially when you go to places with only big groups of people who seem to stare at you because you're alone (that's probably just you being paranoid, but still). It's in those moments that you need a place like this one, where it doesn't matter if you're alone or with friends, where people are just sitting back in comfy chairs reading the newspaper or typing on their computer and groups of friends are calmly enjoying their coffee (which doesn't mean the atmosphere is boring, it's quite the opposite!). I bumped into this place after a long and tiring walk so it was the perfect spot to take a break and read a book. I'd say this is a good place to study or write a paper but the music is loud so unless loud music is your key to concentration, it's not ideal for that. The banana smoothy is delicious and the decoration is messy in a cozy way.Place to be for all you lonely Londoners (or for people with loads of friends too of course)!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

LRK3Hk1q4iYIsA-CJ3UiQg.text: I live locally in the area, and this is my go-to coffee shop. The service is quick and friendly. The space is large enough to lounge around with friends during the day. Try the Fat Wife (flat white) and make sure to get a loyalty card on your way out!

LAlb72XYN-5Xps-h11TQ2w.text: Nice place. Comfy seats and sofas. Chilled music (experimental electronica) which matches the not too loud, not too quiet ambience. Similarly, not too light but not too dark - cool lights and decorations too. Could spend many hours relaxing here I feel. Coffee is decent too (latte is £2-3 depending on size).

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

3jaH1WXRRcffEoAZjmwkpA.text: music is not that loud which makes the place a nice place to read. coffee was good. leather couches are comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom. fuck 'em all and get a free coffee!
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

YsMbyYhyOiyHdW70OgzBwg.text: My go-to coffee spot in the neighborhood. Bermondsey Street Coffee has decent coffee, a nice little selection of cakes and snacks, and plenty of space during the week if you want to veg for a few hours, read a good book, or just shoot the breeze with a friend.Coffee is on the pricy side, but I'd rather pay a few extra pence to sit and sip my coffee in peace instead of cramming onto a packed communal table at Monmouth Coffee over by Borough Market. Two things that are somewhat irritating: 1) the tables by the door are welded into the floor, but they're really far out from the benches... so you have to perch at the very edge of your seat or otherwise, just be very tall and willing to hunch over your laptop. 2) there's free wifi, but you need to ask them for a logon code every hour because it kicks you off after 60 minutes. It's 2014, just give me free and open Wifi access already...

HE_V8_aAvgKnxtn7rZ0Czg.text: Best coffee in the area in my opinion, better than Monmouth I'd say. It has a rather relaxed vibe and they lay the hipster on you thick. It does get rather busy at times which can be a ballache if you're looking to sit about for a bit on a peak hour you may have trouble. The couch configuration can be misleading as what appears to be free space can not be so leaving you disappointed and perhaps looking a fool.

bCLSRjIXTSvAwsuysw3sJg.text: Awesome little shop with lots of options from premade meals to smoothies. Chill atmosphere with free WiFi

qQXfBS_NHdcHBLQfesAR4Q.text: Very unique little coffee shop. They even have a framed rejected trademark notice that hangs in the restroom. I got the muthafucka smoothie and was not disappointed. It put me to sleep, but I appreciate that they used real peanut butter.Check it out and enjoy the coffee and spectacle ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

Pn83t1Fh_pRWvFK1n5LEsQ.text: On a hot July day, we sought out Fuckoffee because of the snarky name, but I gotta say, they made the BEST iced mocha w/ oat milk that I had in our entire 2 weeks in London & Paris. So delicious, and the balance of coffee and chocolate was just right. Well done, barista-guy.Very hipster in there (I felt really old there, but not really out of place) but comfortable and the loo was even pretty clean. Nice place and those who live/work nearby should consider themselves lucky to have it!

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

UJdrpLHyiMzMIcPPs3rN9A.text: Delicious coffee and cake. Comfy environment. However, WiFi is only available for 2 hours.

kL4_pmRrtszVGZRycUV13Q.text: A trendy and hipster coffee shop tucked away on Bermondsey Street and also a great place to do work. I'm staying in the area for two weeks and have come here a few times to get work done. There's wifi, lots of outlets, and a great selection of coffee and soups for lunch. I didn't get to try any of the soups but they all sound and smell amazing. The cappuccino here is pretty good. My only complaint is that it's not hot enough for me, but the vibes of this place make up for it. The place gets pretty busy around lunch time but I've always managed to find a seat. The baristas are all very friendly and the atmosphere is cozy. Overall, Fuckoffee is a pretty good place to hang out, have lunch and enjoy the electric music or plug in and study with some good coffee.

HW5By6GTAqciA4Usmdy5Qg.text: Yes....its another since I moved to Bermondsey post....but whatever...!!!On my walk to work every morning I wander along the lovely Bermondsey Street, with plentiful coffee shops it can be hard to decide where to get my morning coffee hit....! Having tried most of the options, I have landed on Fuckoffee, they arent just a numerous name which they play on to great effect they also have an exceptional product. They have a huge range of baked goodies for your nibbling pleasures as well as small selection of breakfast and lunch options. Go for the name...stay for the coffee!

Bzur4PVWv1Rs-zUHnjzPxQ.text: Best Chai here. Creamy but not too sweet. Great atmosphere with mellow music and chill vibe. In town from the States on holiday and this was our first stop. Bermondsey is a great area for casual lunch and this place fits the bill. Best chili con carne in area.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

NCopmgSr5VeqAnjcDZfNcw.text: Great coffee and pastries. Fastest service I've ever had at a coffee house and the team here is friendly. The atmosphere is very laid back and the stuff on the walls is hilarious. I wish we had a place like this back home. It's a short distance to some of London's most famous attractions and worth the walk from the tube to get here.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

n67HRvcEny7iFVWOuVu6xA.text: Perfect place to have a quick coffee or tea. The artwork and vibe of the restaurant is very chill and fun. The menu is very reasonably priced and absolutely delicious. Its very easy to find and you get your drink within 10 minutes of ordering. they have tables and chairs but they also have very comfortable couches to relax or work in.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

JCq4mqswpCTNaUHVClLsnw.text: Nice coffee spot with a great vibe and most importantly great coffee. However, they use disposable cups (even for dining in and glasses of water) which is bad for the environment and also ruins the taste in my opinion. Great music playing and good selection of cakes too. WiFi is not great so keep that in mind if you want to work or study but a good place to meet socially.

H4IysSQN0CHE6ImnC1q7nA.text: Loving the Brooklyn / Shoreditch vibe of f-koffee. It's exquisitely hipster with concrete floors, quirky details (like the Lego made pots and dog or 'bitch' biscuits), and feels like a bit of an artist's collage.Great detailing, right down to the (working) Bit Coin machine out back.I think they're trying to go with for coffee with bad-ass attitude and it works.Coffee is reasonable, not a bad price and not a bad taste.They also do a nice chocolate brownie - extremely gooey and finger sticking good.Nice place to hang out if you want a hot beverage, staff are friendly despite the impression you might get from the name.It's always quite busy, full of those laptop welding sorts, although interestingly not a sea of Mac to be seen!

Ycl2mhJ_VrU_boadxsbGIw.text: I'm probably going to be judged for only awarding the place 3 stars but please hear me out!Fuckoffee is a seriously Hipster vibe of a coffee haunt on Bermondsey street, with sister coffee joints over London - and the Hipster scene is something they do extraordinarily well! Kitsch decor, puns all over the menu and walls, obscenities to tickle your fancy ('Cockalate' on your cappucino anyone?). They offer a good selection of cakes and patisseries - catering for all you dietary needy GF and Vegan Foodies (God, love ya). In terms of barista skills I'm going to have to go with another A-OK review. I've been here more than a few times, as it does always impress friends but after visiting again this weekend I have decided that enough is enough with the luke-warm bland soya lattes and slightly burnt flat whites.Don't get me wrong, the staff are the nicest, it's a good place to hang out, and if you're a Mac Book owner you probably don't want to be seen dead in any of the other coffee joints along Bermondsey Street. But coffee is what I go here for, coffee is what I pay for and if I'm not particularly enjoying it I just have to reel in my hipster wannabe mentality (time to leave that phase behind gracefully) and say no more.Definitely worth visiting to obtain one of their customer loyalty cards - seriously neat - But if you need me, I'll be in Hej. Thoroughly enjoying my coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

HaEH_dKGknwkS_rX_ZFL6A.text: Amazing little spot with colourful decor, wonderful baristas, and a fantastic selection of pastries. I was ecstatic they served filter coffee, I find most coffee shops in London do not, and as a plus all of the drinks were incredibly inexpensive. I had the coffee and walnut cake and it was absolutely to die for, I'm already craving another slice!  Will definitely be going back!  Despite the line being out the door when I arrived, they moved through everyone so quickly and still had plenty of seats to choose from.

pftbp_AY7g3Pvbl1GLNC4w.text: Favourite coffee shop in South London. Weekends it is packed but most weekdays you can find a spot to sit and write or read. Outstanding coffee first and foremost but always feel welcome and comfortable within the shop too!

QScoEyh9bZUOpZ4-zEcl_w.text: A feisty little coffee shop with a slightly aggressive play on words located near London Bridge.I stopped in here on a Sunday morning to grab a dirty chai ( chai with a shot of espresso) and was very amused.There is a loyalty card that you have punched with each coffee ( punches read f*uck it, off, etc with the last one being f*uck coffee for a free one!)My Dirty Chai caffeinated me to home and beyond- definitely something I would have again- but not after 5 pm. They also have some fun breakfast pastries, smoothies, juice, etc. Fun place, if I lived nearby I would live here in the am.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

r0HPsl1D6ASjCvhgg1FuIQ.text: One of the few good cafes in Bermondsey/ London Bridge area. Very popular so people tend to share the tables and sofas. The interior is very eclectic and it may you feel like you are in the middle of Shoreditch or East London. They have nice cakes and sweets to go with your drink. You can also buy their coffee to prepare at home in the counter.

eLc3NjFJfRdgckMSWfq-bg.text: The atmosphere is cosy and friendly; the coffee is great, with plenty of dairy-free options; the snacks are plenty with lots of options for vegans too; as for the wifi, it's never let me down. Come for the coffee, stay for the eclectic music selection, super friendly staff, friendly and safe atmosphere.

nHBhVlARmq-A5XZ_GZE7LA.text: So the founders behind brick lane coffee set up another outrageously named shop and obviously it's been one place I've been meaning to visit ever since. Aside from the name, what else will draw you in .. ummm the coffee is pretty good. Essentially though it's nothing out of the ordinary cafe wise, with the hot chocolate getting a bad rating from my friend. Her words were its meh.. Too bitter, not enough of it and mostly all cream. Not a glowing rating then.I guess I went with super high expectations, otherwise this could have easily been a 4 star, judging only on coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom. Smoothie menu
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom. Lego
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom. Hot chocolate with cream

bN-OZfHvdvK_54NmjOm9zw.text: I mean lets be honest the name alone makes this place just f*cking awesome, but the name alone isn't what makes this place so cool. There's a great vibe here, from the girls girls girls neon sign outside to art on the walls. We were lucky enough to nab a very comfy sofa which was extra satisfying! I got a smoothie which was delicious and couldn't help but get a packet to love hearts to go with it! I also had a taste of my friends chai latte which was really tasty too! The loyalty cards are also amazing! Definitely will come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Fuckoffee - London, United Kingdom

ESNRsdfZcrhioRr7bafU3w.text: A coffee place that is the sister of one of my fav coffee places in London (Brick Lane coffee house).This seems to replicate the same decor tho Brick lane has more character still. The coffee is good and though this street will grow ever more popular; it already is developing VERY fasting not sold on it yet. But it is in a part of town that needed it, so I'm down with that.
